resources.string: The Vocational Training Authority of Sri Lanka(VTA) was established on 16th August 1995 under the provisions of the Vocational Training Authority of Sri Lanka Act No.12 of 1995.It was a concept of His Excellency the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa when he was the Hon. Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training. VTA was established with the intent to provide skills for employment. The Manpower Division, the training arm of Labor Department which was running Technical and Vocational training programs in many parts of Sri Lanka, this was converted to the newly constitute Vocational Training Authority (VTA) making vocational training more accessible to rural youth and depressed segments in the country.\n \nThe key intention behind establishing the VTA was to reach the rural mass of the country which was 72% of the total population, and make them to be skillful to find employment opportunities both locally and internationally. The the Board of Directors representing various ministries assigned with specific subjects areas, i.e., youth affairs, education, industrial development, finance and labor including the corporate sector.
To be the most dynamic and innovative vocational training provider in Sri Lanka, catering to the global employment market.

To facilitate the fulfilment of the global skilled employment demand by developing competencies in individuals through modern methods and technologies in vocational training and education. We realize this mission by setting the highest standards in our services and facilities while focusing on employability trends in the world of work.

string.name: ndict
string.font: \n\n•This is the ideal course for beginners who wish to obtain a through knowledge in ICT for highest studies,or for those who wish to take up careers in Information Technology Graduation.

\n\n
NVQ Level 4 OR NVQ Level 3 OR A/Level 3 Simple Pass Included ICT With O/Level 6 Credit Pass Over 60% add the Entrance Examination Conducted by the VTA

Semester 1
 
• Database System 1 

• Graphic Design 

• Software Programming 

• System Analysis And Design 

• Workplace Information Management 

• Workplace Communication Management


 Semester 2
 

• Database System 2 

• Software Testing 

• Web Programming 

• Local Area Network (LAN) 

• Planning and Scheduling Work at Workplace

string.name: ndqs
string.font: \n\n•The Quantity Surveyor NVQ Level 5 course provides advanced training for professionals who want to become experts in the field of construction cost management, estimating, and project management. Students will gain knowledge and skills in analyzing and controlling project costs, as well as effective communication and team management skills.

Semester 1
 

• Mathematics 

• Building Measurements I 

• Building Construction Technology 

• Law in Construction 

• Workplace Information Management 

 Semester 2
 

• Building Measurements II 

• Preliminary Estimating 

• Cost Planning and Analysis 

• Procurement in Construction 

• Estimating and Building 

• General Economics 

• Standard Forms of Contract 

• Workplace Communication Management 

• Planning and Scheduling Work at Workplace

string.name: ict4
string.font: \n\n•The NVQ4 in Information Communication Technology (ICT) Technician is a comprehensive course that equips students with the technical knowledge and practical skills needed to work as competent ICT Technicians in various settings. The course covers hardware and software installation, network administration, database management , Static web development, and programming, among other topics.

\n\n
NVQ Level 3 OR O/Level 6 Credit Pass Included Science,Maths and English

• Maintain Files and Folders 

• Perform Word Processing 

• Prepare Spread Sheet 

• Prepare Presentation 

• Maintain Database 

• Perform Internet and Electronic Mail Operation 

• Install and Configure Operating System 

• Conduct tion and Trouble Shooting Network From Client PC 

• Develop Graphics For Web/Print Media 

• Design and Develop Static Web Pages 

• Develop Basic Software Solution

string.name: machinist4
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Machinist is a vocational training program that focuses on developing practical skills in machining and metalworking, preparing students for a career in the manufacturing industry. Upon completion, students are equipped with the necessary skills to operate a range of machine tools and interpret engineering drawings to produce precision components for various applications

\n\n
O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths OR Eligible For 13+ Education

• Communication Skills for Workplace 

• Workshop Calculation and Science 

• Team Work 

•Occupational Health, Safety and Environmental Protections 

• Maintenance and Service of Machine 

• Mechanical Drawing 

• Properties of Material 

• Hand Tools, Measuring Instruments 

• Lathe Operation 

• Lathe Operation - Thread Cutting 

• Drilling Operations 

• Tools Grinding 

• Grinding Operation 

• Conventional Milling Operation 

• Tools and Cutter Grinding 

• Machine Gears

string.name: cnc4
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Computer Numerical Control (CNC) is a comprehensive course that prepares students to become competent CNC operators, programmers, and machinists. The course covers various aspects of CNC machining, including programming, setup, operation, and maintenance of CNC machines, as well as safety procedures and quality control measures.

\n\n
NVQ Level 04 Certificate In Machinist With O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths

string.name: act
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning Technician is a comprehensive course that prepares students to become competent technicians in the refrigeration and air conditioning industry. The course covers installation, repair, maintenance, and troubleshooting of refrigeration and air conditioning systems, as well as safety procedures, environmental regulations, and customer service

\n\n
O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths and Science

• Occupational Safety, Health and Environmental Safety 

• Team Work 

• Basic Workshop Practice 

• Fundamentals of Electricity 

• Welding and Brazing 

• Fundamentals of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning 

• Repair and Maintenance of Refrigerators Bottle Cooler and Deep Freezers 

• Repairing and Maintaining of Domestic Air Conditioners 

• Troubleshooting and Rectifying of Fault in Air Conditioner 

• Installation of Domestic Air Conditioner 

• Prepare Cost Estimate For Repair 

• Communication Skill for Workplace 

• Variable Refrigerant Volume (VRV) Variable Refrigerant Flow (VRF) System 

• Installation of Water - Cooler Air Conditioners 

• Pipeline Installation 

• Cooling Tower and Condenser Pump 

• Servicing Of Air - Cooled Air - Conditioning Units 

• Servicing of Water - Cooler Air - Conditioning Units 

• Servicing of Cooling Tower and Conditioner Pump 

• Green Technology for Refrigeration and Air Conditioning 

• Recovery and Recharging Of Refrigerant

string.name: electro
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Electronics is a comprehensive course that equips students with the technical knowledge and practical skills needed to work as competent electronics technicians in various settings. The course covers electronic circuits, digital electronics, microprocessors, communication systems, and instrumentation, as well as safety procedures, electrical regulations, and customer service.

\n\n
O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths and Science

• Occupational Safety, Health 

• Basic Electricity 

• Basic Electronic 

• Measure Values Of Electronic Components 

• Information Technology 

• Test and Replace Electronics Components 

• Digital Electronic 

• Operational Amplifiers and Application 

• Diagnose Faults in Electronic Components 

• Repair Power Supply 

• Repair Amplifier Stage 

• Repair Main System Board 

• Rectify Software Issue 

• Repair/Replace Wireless Communication Devices 

• Install Audio Video System 

• Repair Optical Device and Sensors 

• Install Satellite Receiver (TVRO) 

• Perform Network Configuration 

• Repair Display Devices 

• Interact With Customer 

• Prepare Estimate foe Repair/Service 

• Building Career Skills

string.name: wood
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Wood Craftsman and Furniture with Aluminum Fabricator is a comprehensive course that focuses on developing practical skills in woodworking, furniture making, and aluminum fabrication. Upon completion, students are equipped with the necessary skills to work as craftsmen and fabricators in the furniture and aluminum industries. The course covers various aspects of woodworking and aluminum fabrication, including design, layout, assembly, finishing, and installation.

• Trade Calculation 

• Technical Drawing (Relevant to Wood Technology) 

• Use Hand Tool 

• Cut Timber/Boards(Basic) 

• Cut Timber/Boards(Advanced) 

• Plane Timber 

• Plane Make and Profile Timber 

• Sharpen Carpentry Tools and Maintain Relevant Hand Tools, Basic Power Tools and Machinery 

• Drill,Mortise and Tenon Timber 

• Make Basic Timber Joints 

• Turn Wood 

• Fix Accessories 

• Prepare Wood Surface(Using Sand Papers) 

• Finish Wood Surface 

• Spray Wood Surface 

• Affix Finished Materials on Wood Surface 

• Prepare Estimates 

• Make Furniture Using Solid Wood 

• Make Furniture Using Wood Based Boards (Wood Based Composite Panel)`

string.name: beauty
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Beautician is a comprehensive course that prepares students for a career in the beauty industry. The course covers a range of topics, including skin care, makeup, hair removal, nail care, and body treatments, as well as health and safety, customer service, and product knowledge.

\n\n
O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths and Science

• Perform Make-up 

• Care Feet and Nails (Pedicure) 

• Care Hands and Nails ( Manicure) 

• Remove superfluous Hair 

• Perform Skin care treatment 

• Perform Basic Facial 

• Analyze Skin 

• Maintain Machinery, Tools and Equipments 

• Receive client and prepare for saloon services 

• Maintain safe and pleasant beauty salon environment 

• Basic module

string.name: haird
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Hair Dressing is a comprehensive course that prepares students for a career in the hairdressing industry. The course covers a range of topics, including hair cutting, styling, coloring, and chemical treatments, as well as health and safety, customer service, and product knowledge.

• Receive Clients and Prepare for Salon Services 

• Maintain Safe and Pleasant Beauty Salon Environment 

• Maintain Machinery Tools, Equipment and Materials

• Cut and Style Hair 

• Maintain safe and pleasant beauty salon environment 

• Color Hair 

• Style Long Hair 

• Set Hair (Temporarily) 

• Use of Wigs 

• Provide advice and promote hair products and services

string.name: autot
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Automobile Technician is a comprehensive course that prepares students for a career in the automotive industry. The course covers various aspects of vehicle maintenance, including engine repair, electrical systems, suspension, steering, and brakes, as well as safety procedures, customer service, and environmental regulations.

\n\n
O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths and Science

• Workshop Safety and Health 

• Technical Mathematics And Technology 

• Workshop Technology 

• Technical Drawings 

• Fundamentals Of Electrical And Electronic 

• Fundamentals Of Automobile 

• Automobile Engines 

• Engine System 

• Petrol And Diesel Fuel System 

• Conventional And Breaker Less Ignition System 

• Petrol Electronic Fuel Injection System 

• Diesel Electronic Fuel Injection System 

• Power Train System I 

• Power Train System II 

• Manual And Power Assisted Steering System 

• Conventional And Electronically Controlled Suspension System 

• Hydraulic And Pneumatic Braking System 

• Electronically Controlled Braking System 

• Hub Mounting Wheels And Tire 

• Wheel Balancing And Wheel Alignment 

• Vehicle Electrical And Electronic System 

• Passenger Safety And Vehicle Security System 

• Engine Overhauling 

• Engine Fault Troubleshooting 

• Automobile Pollution And Control 

• Hybrid Vehicle System 

• Electric Vehicle

string.name: elctricalt
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Electrical is a comprehensive course that equips students with the technical knowledge and practical skills needed to work as competent electricians in various settings. The course covers installation, repair, and maintenance of electrical systems, as well as safety procedures, electrical regulations, and customer service.

string.name: agri
string.font:
\n\n
The NVQ4 in Agriculture is a comprehensive course that prepares students for a career in the agriculture industry. The course covers various aspects of such as farming, including crop production, livestock management, soil management, irrigation, and pest control, as well as safety procedures, environmental regulations, and business management.

\n\n
O/Level 6 Passes Included Maths and Science

• Fundamentals of Agriculture 

• Establishment and maintenance of Paddy and other cereals 

• Establishment and maintenance of other field crops(OFC) 

• Establishment and maintenance of Horticultural crops 

• Harvesting and primary processing 

• Maintenance of farm Machineries, Equipment and Tools 

• Implementation of Agricultural Extension Programme 

• Communication Skills for Workplace 

• Language Literacy and Numeracy 

• Team Work 

• Occupational Health and Safety Procedures and Practice

string.name: cgd
string.font:
\n\n
The Computer Graphics Design NVQ Level 4 course provides advanced training for individuals who want to specialize in graphic design, digital art, and multimedia. Students will gain knowledge and skills in designing creative visual communication using industry-standard software and tools.

\n\n
NVQ Level 3 OR O/Level 6 Credit Pass Included Science,Maths and English

• Typography

• Illustrations

• Communication skills for workplace 

• Workplace calculation and science 

• Team work 

• Occupational safety and health and environmental aspects

string.name: bake
string.font:
\n\n
The Baker NVQ Level 4 course provides specialized training for individuals who want to become professional bakers. Students will learn the art of making a variety of baked goods, including bread, cakes, and pastries, as well as proper food handling and safety practices

string.name: alu
string.font:
\n\n
The Aluminum Fabricator NVQ Level 4 course provides specialized training for individuals who want to become professional fabricators. Students will learn how to cut, shape, and assemble aluminum materials to create various products such as doors, windows, and frames, using advanced tools and techniques.

string.name: plumber
string.font:
\n\n
The Plumber NVQ Level 4 course provides specialized training for individuals who want to become professional plumbers. Students will learn how to install and maintain plumbing systems, including water supply, drainage, and heating, as well as how to follow industry-standard safety practices.

• Job role and carrier skill in Plumbing and plumbing maintenance 

• Communication skills for workplace 

• Workshop calculation and Science 

• Occupational Safety and Health 

• Team work 

• Simple Masonry work

• Fix Taps, Valves and Other Fittings 

• Lay Hot Water Pipelines and Fix Fittings 

• Fix Rain Water System 

• Lay Soil and Drainage Pipes 

• Fix Common Sanitary Fittings and Accessories 

• Fix Sanitary and Drainage Fittings 

• Prepare Metal Pipelines 

• Lay Metal Pipelines and Fix Fittings 

• Fix Water Pump System

string.name: tailor
string.font:
\n\n
The Professional Tailor Ladies\' and Children\'s NVQ Level 4 course provides specialized training for individuals who want to become professional tailors, with a focus on women\'s and children\'s clothing. Students will learn how to create customized patterns, cut fabrics, and use various sewing techniques to create high-quality garments that meet client specifications.

• Introduction to tailoring 

• Tailoring materials/fabrics and accessories 

• Operation and maintenance of machinery, tools and equipment use in tailoring 

• Procedure for taking body Measurement 

• Pattern drafting in tailoring 

• Fabric pre-preparation for cut and sew 

• Draft and cut different styles of Ladies garment 

• Sewing techniques 

• Sewing methods for different stylesLadies 

• Draft and cut different styles of Gents garment 

• Sewing methods for different stylesGents 

• Draft, Cut and sew coat and waist coat 

• Finish the garment 

• Preparation of order 

• Practice workplace communication and interpersonal relations 

• Apply occupational literacy and numeracy 

• Work in team 

• Practice occupational health and safety measures

string.name: wheel
string.font:
\n\n
The Three Wheel Mechanic NVQ Level 3 course provides specialized training for individuals who want to become professional mechanics for three-wheeled vehicles. Students will learn how to diagnose and repair mechanical issues, as well as how to maintain these vehicles to keep them in optimal condition.

• Communication skills for workplace 

• Workshop calculation and Science 

• Work in teams 

• Occupational Health and Safety Procedures and Practice 

• Steering System 

• Break system 

• Suspension system 

• Electrical system 

• Ignition system 

• Engine 

• Transmission system 

• Fuel and air intake system

resources.string:
Introduction 


The Certificate in English Language provided by the Vocational Training Authority (VTA) is designed for individuals who want to improve their English language skills. This certificate program focuses on developing proficiency in reading, writing, listening, and speaking English, with an emphasis on practical usage in both personal and professional settings. 

Entry Qualifications 


No 

Course Modules 

• Basic Grammar


Duration

150hrs 

NVQ Certificate Level

Certificate In English Language-VTA 

Available Centres 

• NVTI Vantharmoolai

string.name: elec3
string.font:
\n\n
The Electrical - Domestics NVQ Level 3 course provides specialized training for individuals who want to become professional electricians in the domestic sector. Students will learn how to install, repair and maintain electrical systems and equipment in residential buildings, with a focus on safety and compliance with industry standards.

• Communication skills for workplace 

• Workshop Calculation and Science 

• Team Work 

• Occupational Health and Safety 

• Basic Workshop Practice 

• Principles of Electricity 

• Draw Wiring Diagrams

• Inspect, test, diagnose and repair faults in electrification's of buildings 

• Prepare Cost Estimates 

• Carry out industrial electrical Installations 

• Assemble LV distribution boards 

• Install, repair and maintain electrical control circuits and equipment 

• Repair and maintain electrical appliances and equipment 

• Maintain and repair of electric motors 

• Maintain and repair standby generators and LV transformers 

• Carry out commissioning, maintaining and decommissioning of industrial electrical installations 

• Install and maintain Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) 

• Proposal preparation for IOT based automation requirements 

• Installation and Maintenance work
